author: hustla187
title: Two of the Best F1 Racers
review: I'm surprised that no one has reviewed this yet. You get the legendary Micheal Schumacher and R. Barrichello(I forgot the first name). You also get a silver trophy and a winner's circle. This is a must own for any F1 racing fan.

author: Alemas
title: You get the legends themselves: Michael Schumacher and Rubens Barrichello!
review:
This is a great set to have, and I have TWO of these! It has a trophy(rare), Michael Schumacher, Rubens Barrichello, and their helmets!

Pros:

M.Schumacher
R.Barrichello
Rare trophy
Helmets
Stickers! Yes, this is NOT an hallucination or error! I like stickers!

Cons:

None!

Overall, a great set!

author: davy_jones
title: Child of passion
review:
This set is definately one for the Tifosi. Absolutely clever marketing technique by Lego To capture one of the most glorious moments in the Prancing Horse's racing history.
 Get this set if you're a huge Ferrari fan and already have an expanding Ferrari series in the Creator collection. It even has a large holy grail...errr trophy! But I'll have to be honest and say that there almost nil playability with other sets. When it comes to a piece for mantle adornment however, it can hardly be beaten. Surely for the passionate then...

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Racers (Ferrari) - M. Schumacher and R. Barrichello Review
review:
This set is my only set with the Formula 1 drivers Michael Schumacher and Rubens Barrichello. I'm a huge fan of the Formula 1 and my favourite driver is Schumacher. The details on Schumacher's and Barrichello's face are really good. Also the details on the overalls and their helmets.

The trophy is a cool piece to have but it's a little bit too big for the minifig. What I don't like about this set is that the torso of the minifigs have stickers. If you're a Formula 1 fan I would recommend you to get this set - even if this set has no play features. The minifigs are a great addition to your LEGO collection and to the LEGO Racers (Ferrari) theme. And I also hope that LEGO is going to do a F1 theme with all teams, drivers and tracks since 1950 of course.

All in all this set is a good model and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

author: modena
title: This set really receives a trophy! (Oh, it's got one.)
review:
I got this set a while ago, but I still play with it in our vacation house!

Pros

  • Trophy!
  • Has two great stars of F1!
  • Flags and a stage!
  • Minifigs can either wear caps or helmets!

Cons

  • Helmets, but where's the cars!
  • Ehm... 6 years later, the stickers fall off!

Overall:

This was a great set, and it is still fully preserved. The parts in this set shine (like the trophy) and the minifigures aren't as bad either. The only things that bother me is that this set doesn't have a car. Why does this set then need a pair of helmets? Kind of silly. The stage with the flags seems very nice, and I still use it for stop-motion. (I use the whole set!) The stickers will fall off, but maybe they look better without. 

Overall, get it, but make sure you have some cars to race with!
